definition: to restructure/to reorganize/to revamp
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
steam reforming (chemistry)
Order of Augustinian Recollects, a mendicant Catholic religious order of friars and nuns
pinyin: Zhong4 zheng3 Ao4 si1 ding4 hui4

sentences.english: A spectrophotometric method for determining rhenium content in Pt Re reforming catalysts is reported in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 提出了用分光光度法测定重整催化剂中铼含量的方法。

sentences.english: The welding and welded joint marking method of U type pipe in furnace for platinum reforming was introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了铂重整加热炉U型炉管的焊接与焊缝标注方法。

sentences.english: Now, the cultural-relic department determines to repair the Buddha and recondition its vicinity.
sentences.chinese: 文物部门决定重修大佛，重整大佛及周边环境。

sentences.english: The commander was able to rally the fleeing troops.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官能够重整其溃散的部队。

sentences.english: The team was thrown on(to) the defensive as their opponents rallied.
sentences.chinese: 该队在对手重整旗鼓后，被迫采取守势。

sentences.english: The main fear was that both sides might seize (up) on a cease-fire to rearm.
sentences.chinese: 主要的担心在于双方都可能抓住停火时机重整军备。

sentences.english: In this paper soft sensing on coking models of reactor in the process of continuous catalytic reforming is studied.
sentences.chinese: 对连续催化重整反应器结焦含量软测量问题进行研究。

sentences.english: Realigning and Initiating the Next Move of God.
sentences.chinese: 重整与启动上帝的下一步行动。

sentences.english: Man who were broken only a year before suddenly felt restored.
sentences.chinese: 一年前破了产的人突然间重整起旗鼓。

sentences.english: Realigning the Next Move of Glory Restoration.
sentences.chinese: 重整荣耀恢复的下一波行动。

sentences.english: Hasdrubal re-formed his forces and moved into Italy.
sentences.chinese: 哈斯德鲁巴重整了他的军队，然后向意大利进军。

sentences.english: I wonder if there's any chance of reassembling my army and reconquering the world.
sentences.chinese: 我有机会重整旗鼓，征服世界吗？

sentences.english: The fleeing troops rallied and prepared for a last-ditch fight.
sentences.chinese: 溃军重整旗鼓，准备背水一战。

sentences.english: By then, however, the band was splintering up, never to regain its momentum. DH
sentences.chinese: 然而，到那时乐队正四分五裂，且从未重整旗鼓。

sentences.english: Molecular modeling and optimization for naphtha catalytic reforming process is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 采用分子模拟方法对石脑油催化重整过程进行研究。

sentences.english: After re-processing, the divergence difficulties could be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 经重整化处理后，发散困难得以解决。

to recall/to revoke/to retract

lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
to plan and prepare
to purge
to settle accounts/to clear accounts/to liquidate/to expose and criticize
to save from damage/to preserve/to maintain/to keep in good repair/(Tw) security guard
to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
to separate off/to hive off/a demerger
to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
perilous situation
to spruce up/to renovate/to tend (a garden)/to groom (one's hair)/to finish (a rough surface)/to trim (a lawn)/to touch up (a photo)
(do sth) on a large scale
